sub_title: Independent Consultant for  Humanitarian Action and Development
summary:
Strong skills in planning, management and implementation of projects and programmes in the humanitarian and developmental sectors ranging from emergency relief interventions, Post-conflict, rehabilitation and long term development interventions

Extensive knowledge of result-based management evaluation, OECD/DAC and  EU-system evaluation standards, as well as participatory monitoring and evaluation methodologies and approaches, particularly in the field of emergency relief,  IDP/Refugee care, WASH, community based health development,  community-based disaster risk reduction and livelihood,  institutional and organisational capacities of NGOs, community and civil society development, youth participation and development, conflict management and peace-building, inter-ethnic relations, democracy building and social development; and women and child protection.

Good experience with technical support on participative development  of project proposals, and long-term  strategies. 

Ample experience with the assessment of project proposals received under EU Call for Proposals, UK Direct and  the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs

Solid experience in spearheading and facilitating capacity-building programmes, including training in program management, M&E, networking skills, institutional, organisational and financial issues of (management) staff, NGOs, non-state actors and governmental institutions and relationship management and resource mobilization with different civil society organizations in Africa.

Excellent inter-cultural and -personal skills, flexibility, open-mindedness and sense of humour, a leader and team player, used to quickly adapt to (difficult) local circumstances and context.

Extensive working experience in Africa (Kenya, Sudan -Darfur, Blue Nile and Kordofan-, South Sudan, Sierra Leone, Liberia, Ivory Coast, Ethiopia, Uganda and Somalia), the Balkans (FYR Macedonia, Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina), China, Haïti, Lebanon, the Philippines, and Nepal.

profile_positions.description:
Between 2010 and to date my consultancy missions  included: mid-term and final evaluations on WASH, community-based health, nutrition, cholera and ebola response,  Disaster Risk Reduction and Livelihood,  Human security voor vulnerable communities (pastoralists),  conflict resolution and peace  building ,  women and child  protection,
 HIV/AIDS, Youth development,  and complex emergencies. In addition I was responsible for the development of project proposals (community-based health, Disaster Risk Reduction, psycho social care for children  and Youth vulnerable for extremism,  and illegal migration  ) in Somaliland, Philipines, South Sudan and Lebanon), a 5-year Road-Map for Darfur and a programme framework and operational manual for youth programming in the Horn of Africa. In between I have done research and reporting on EU winning tenders, assessment of Call for proposals (EU and the Netherlands Government) and facilitated a final conference for  key stakeholders  on the capacity building of red cross societies in West Africa.

profile_positions.title: Independent Assessor for EU Call for Proposals

profile_positions.description: Assisted with the setup of an EU funded pilot programme focussing on strengthening resilience to violent extremism in the Horn of Africa. The programme is based out of Nairobi and will run for 36 months where the team will focus on 4 result areas namely women, youth, law enforcement and diaspora with the aim to test key assumptions around radicalisation and violent extremism. The pilot focusses heavily on strengthening the evidence base with regards to countering violent extremism and aims to provide recommendations for future programming
profile_positions.title: Consultant Programme Administrator

profile_positions.description: Leading, coordinating and facilitating relationship management and resource mobilisation for 14 Red Cross and Red Crescent National Societies and the Secretariat supported programmes in the Eastern Africa Zone. Managing funding coverage of the Federation Annual appeals, emergency Appeals and special funding requests. Facilitating partnership agreements. Responsible for Pledge-and Grants management. Assistance with concept note- and proposal writing.
profile_positions.title: Relationship Management and Resource Mobilisation

profile_positions.description:
Capacity building of five National Red Cross/Red Crescent Societies (Kenya, Ethiopia, Eritrea, Uganda and Sudan) in HIV/Aids, Public Health, Mother and Child Care.
In the context of the sudden unset of post election violence in Kenya end of December 2007, I promoted and advocated for strong communication and cooperation, mediation and crisis-management between all involved Red Cross Movement partners   (Kenya Red Cross, ICRC, IFRC and Participating National Societies). I supported all efforts towards achieving an effective disaster response and addressing the inter-community tensions by coordinating information flow for all involved stakeholders including state and non state actors at national and local level, Nutrition, Disaster preparedness, Organizational Development, conflict management and Peace building. Represented Netherlands Red Cross within Red Cross Movement and to other Partners. End -responsible for reporting to Back Donors.
profile_positions.title: Regional Manager East Africa and Liaison Delegate

profile_positions.location: Albania, Liberia, Macedonia,Darfur and South Sudan
profile_positions.description:
Albania: Evaluation of three local partners. Review of programme proposals including financial and narrative reports. Assessment of the organisational structures (including the role of the Boards, personnel management, financial management, networking, advocacy issues, media relations and geographical and thematic expansion). Assessment of cost effectiveness, sustainability and income generating activities. 

Macedonia: Advised on the implementation of an “Inter-ethnic Relations and Capacity Building” program for students in Skopje and Tetovo. Training of the project team, particularly in strategic planning, preparation of project proposals including fund raising, technical and financial planning, accounting, financial management etc. Trained new Student NGOs in organisational development including networking skills and providing of services to their members with main focus on the improvement of inter-ethnic relations between persons with different religious and ethnic background.

Darfur:Planning and implementation of Women Protection programs in 9 IDP Locations in West Darfur. Emergency Healthcare, Advocacy for Women and Child Rights, Gender Based Violence -training for national staff, community leaders, Peacekeepers (African Union) and International Police and  Psychosocial and conducted a Gender Based Violence needs assessment among IDPs and organised the set off implementation of a community based psychosocial care program in South Darfur.

South Sudan:Institutional capacity building of local partner, including human resource management, project management and monitoring and evaluation. Training in peace building activities related to village water management, public health and hygiene promotion (PHAST) and community development.
